API Reference¶

You will find here the documentation of the modules’ functions.

align¶

This module contains functions for aligning thermal and visible images. Works with PiP and MSX mode of FLIR images.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

22/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.align.align_flir_visible_thermal(image_path, save=False, colorscale='plasma')¶

Aligns visible and thermal FLIR images in PiP or MSX mode.

Parameters

  • image_path – string Path of the .jpg FLIR image, containing thermal and visible images.

  • save – bool Save metadata.csv, visible.jpg, thermal.jpg and flir.jpg images

  • colorscale – string Colorscale to use when saving thermal images. Plasma is near the Flir Iron corlorscale

Returns

tuple (thermal, visible) images

thermalcognition.align.build_flir_pip(image_path, save=False)¶

Reconstruct PiP image from scratch

Parameters

  • image_path – string Flir PiP image

  • save – bool Whether to save the generated PiP image

Returns

(h, w, 3) array Reconstructed flir PiP image

thermalcognition.align.face_template_matching(visible_image, thermal_image, bboxlist)¶

Align visible and thermal face imaging using template matching. Used in VIS-TH database.

Parameters

  • visible_image – (h, w, 3) ndarray Visible image on which face was detected

  • thermal_image – (h, w) ndarray Thermal image to align

  • bboxlist – tuple x1, y1, x2, y2, confidence boundaries of the visible face box

  • net_resolution – int Size of the input layer of the neural network. Default for FAN

  • device – “cpu” or “cuda” Whether to use GPU or CPU

Returns

tuple visible_face and thermal_face

thermalcognition.align.get_ratio(image1, image2)¶

Get the scale ratio between row and column dimensions of two images. If height and width dimensions are different, throws an error.

Parameters

  • image1 – (h, w, 3) or (h, w) array Image to be compared

  • image2 – (h, w, 3) or (h, w) array Reference image

Returns

float Ratio between image1 and the reference image

thermalcognition.align.resize_visible_flirone(visible_image, thermal_image)¶

Resize visible image using thermal image. Used in VIS-TH database.

Parameters

  • visible_image – (h, w, 3) ndarray Visible image on which face was detected

  • thermal_image – (h, w) ndarray Thermal image to align

Returns

tuple visible_face and thermal_face

calibration¶

This module contains functions for calibration temperature in thermal videos with a temperature colorbar.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

22/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.calibration.fill_tempscale_df(tempscale_df, videodata)¶

Fills a discrete temperature scale DataFrame with the previous temperature limits values.

Parameters

  • tempscale_df – pd.DataFrame Containing frame indices of temperature changes and the colorbar limits values.

  • videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray RGB frames of a video including a colorbar

Returns

pd.DataFrame Containing the lower and upper temperature in colorbar for every frame.

thermalcognition.calibration.fit_colorscale(image, y_low=17, y_up=- 18, x_pos=340)¶

Get colorscale of a thermal frame, where part of the frame is a vertical colorbar for temperature. Default parameters are given for the Testo camera settings.

Parameters

  • image – (h, w, 3) ndarray (R,G,B) float features ranging from 0. to 1.

  • y_low – int Vertical lower position of the colorbar

  • y_up – int Vertical upper position of the colorbar

  • x_pos – int Horizontal position of the colorbar

Returns

scikit-learn linear regression model

thermalcognition.calibration.fit_temperature(rgb_image, temperature_image)¶

Fit linear regression from first frame of the video, when temperature array is directly available.

Parameters

  • rgb_image – (h, w, 3) ndarray (R,G,B) float features ranging from 0. to 1.

  • temperature_image – (h, w) ndarray T float feature in °C degrees

Returns

scikit-learn linear regression model

thermalcognition.calibration.frame_has_changed(videodata)¶

Return frame indices when the image changes in time.

Parameters

videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray a video

Returns

ndarray Indices of image changes in time

thermalcognition.calibration.get_temperature_float(img, config='--psm 10 --oem 3')¶

Finds temperature float in image.

Parameters

  • img – (h,w, 3) ndarray RGB image with colorbar

  • config – string Config option of the Tesseract model

Returns

float Temperature

thermalcognition.calibration.get_temperature_scale(frame, interpolation_factor=4, text_size=(11, 35), up_text_pos=(1, 325), low_text_pos=(- 16, 325))¶

Finds upper and lower limit of a Testo temperature frame.

Parameters

  • frame – (h,w, 3) ndarray RGB image with colorbar

  • interpolation_factor – int Interpolating digits makes it easier to recognize characters

  • text_size – (h, w) tuple Shape of the box where to look for digits

  • up_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the upper temperature limit of the colorbar

  • low_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the lower temperature limit of the colorbar

Returns

tuple (lower_temp, upper_temp) found in the frame

thermalcognition.calibration.get_tempscale_df(videodata, text_size=(11, 35), up_text_pos=(1, 325), low_text_pos=(- 16, 325))¶

When colorbar changes in time, new temperature limits are recognized. Default values for Testo videos.

Parameters

  • videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray RGB frames of a video including a colorbar

  • text_size – (h, w) tuple Shape of the box where to look for digits

  • up_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the upper temperature limit of the colorbar

  • low_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the lower temperature limit of the colorbar

Returns

pd.DataFrame Containing frame indices of temperature changes and the colorbar limits values.

thermalcognition.calibration.predict_temperature(rgb_image, linreg_model)¶

Predict temperature of a frame using a linear regression model on the visible image.

Parameters

  • rgb_image – (h, w, 3) ndarray (R,G,B) float features ranging from 0. to 1.

  • linreg_model – scikit-learn linear regression model Converts RGB to temperature

Returns

(h, w) ndarray T float feature in °C degrees

thermalcognition.calibration.predict_temperature_video(rgb_videodata, linreg_model, batch_size=1000000)¶

Predict temperature of a video using a linear regression model on the visible image.

Parameters

  • rgb_videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray (R,G,B) float features ranging from 0. to 1.

  • linreg_model – scikit-learn linear regression model Converts RGB to temperature

  • batch_size – int Number of pixels to process by iteration

Returns

(h, w) ndarray T float feature in °C degrees

thermalcognition.calibration.rgb2temp_video(videodata, tempscale_df, thermal_image_shape=(240, 320), dtype=<class 'numpy.float16'>, batch_size=1000)¶

Converts visible video into temperature video

Parameters

  • videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray RGB frames of a video including a colorbar

  • tempscale_df – pd.DataFrame Containing frame indices of temperature changes and the colorbar limits values.

  • thermal_image_shape – (h,w) tuple Shape of the temperature image, excluding the colorbar, starting from upper left corner

  • dtype – numpy type np.float16, np.float32, np.double, np.long depending of the coding of the temperature values

  • batch_size – int maximum number of frames used by iteration to avoid memory issues

Returns

(n, h, w) ndarray Thermal frames of a video

thermalcognition.calibration.temperature_has_changed_vector(videodata, text_size=(11, 35), up_text_pos=(1, 325), low_text_pos=(- 16, 325))¶

Return frame indices when the colorbar changes in time. Default values for Testo videos.

Parameters

  • videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray RGB frames of a video including a colorbar

  • text_size – (h, w) tuple Shape of the box where to look for digits

  • up_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the upper temperature limit of the colorbar

  • low_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the lower temperature limit of the colorbar

Returns

ndarray Indices of colorbar changes in time

landmarks¶

This module contains functions for extracting landmarks from thermal images.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

22/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.landmarks.load_fan(weights_path, device='cuda')¶

Loads face alignment net from Adrian Bulat. Trained models come from “https://www.adrianbulat.com/downloads/python-fan/2DFAN4-11f355bf06.pth.tar”

Parameters

  • weights_path – string Location of the compressed weights object

  • device – “cuda” or “cpu” Whether use a GPU or a CPU

Returns

torch nn The face alignment neural network for landmarks detection

thermalcognition.landmarks.postprocess_landmarks(pts, crops=None, h=None, center=None, scale=None, net_resolution=256, mode='auto')¶

Prepares superposition of landmarks on the original figure

Parameters

  • pts – (68, 2) ndarray Face landmarks and their row and column position

  • crops – tuple of integers Indices of top, bottom, left, and right crops of the original image

  • h – int height of the original image

  • center – ndarray Center of the face

  • scale – float Scale of the face

  • mode – “auto” or “manual” Whether face detection is manual or automatic

  • net_resolution – int Size of the input layer of the neural network. Default for FAN

Returns

(68, 2) ndarray Face landmarks and their row and column position in the original figure

thermalcognition.landmarks.predict_landmarks(image, net)¶

Predicts landmarks of the face.

Parameters

  • image – (h, w, 3) ndarray Image of the face in RGB

  • net – torch nn The FAN network for landmarks detection

Returns

(68, 2) ndarray Face landmarks and their row and column position

thermalcognition.landmarks.predict_landmarks_video(videodata, video_path, landmarks_detector_path, n_landmarks=68, decimate=1000, dpi=100, device='cuda', save=False)¶

Predicts landmarks of the face video.

Parameters

  • videodata – (n, h, w, 3) ndarray Visible video of the face

  • video_path – string The video path

  • landmarks_detector_path – string Location of the compressed weights object

  • n_landmarks – int Number of landmarks detected by frame

  • decimate – int Decimation factor to shorten computation time

  • dpi – int Resolution of output image

  • device – “cuda” or “cpu” Whether use a GPU or a CPU

  • save – bool Wether to save landmarks as mp4 and csv files

Returns

pd.DataFrame Contains landmarks position at every frame

thermalcognition.landmarks.preprocess_face(image, crops, net_resolution=256, device='cuda')¶

Prepare face for landmark detection using FAN.

Parameters

  • image – (h, w, 3) or (h, w) ndarray Image of the face

  • crops – tuple of integers Indices of top, bottom, left, and right crops

  • net_resolution – int Size of the input layer of the neural network. Default for FAN

  • device – “cpu” or “cuda” Whether to use GPU or CPU

Returns

tuple (h, w, 3) ndarray image of the face in RGB, center of the face, scale of the face

reader¶

This module contains functions for reading and extracting face of thermal videos.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

22/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.reader.crop(image, center, scale, resolution=256.0)¶

Center crops an image or set of heatmaps

Parameters

  • image – ndarray an rgb image

  • center – ndarray the center of the object, usually the same as of the bounding box

  • scale – float scale of the face

  • resolution – float the size of the output cropped image (default: {256.0})

Returns

ndarray an rgb image, cropped around the center

thermalcognition.reader.crop_face(image, crops=None, mode='thermal')¶

Manually crops face of an image.

Parameters

  • image – (h, w) ndarray Contains the image to crop. Can also be a video.

  • crops – tuple of integers Indices of left, top, right, bottom crops. None if mode is auto

  • mode – “thermal” or “visible” The nature of the input image

Returns

(h, w) ndarray Image or video of the face

thermalcognition.reader.get_crops(image, path_to_detector, device='cuda')¶

Detect faces automatically with a SFD detector.

Parameters

  • image – (h, w, 3) ndarray Contains the image to crop. Can also be a video.

  • path_to_detector – (h, w, 3) ndarray Contains the image to crop. Can also be a video.

  • device – “cuda” or “cpu” Whether to use GPU or CPU

Returns

tuple of integers Indices of top, bottom, left, and right crops. None if mode is auto

thermalcognition.reader.get_video_info(video_path)¶

Get the statistics of a video using FFProbe

Parameters

video_path – string The video path

Returns

tuple (duration, nb_frames, fps) of the video using FFProbe

thermalcognition.reader.read_flir_image_metadata(image_path)¶

Reads FLIR image metadata using Exiftool.

Parameters

image_path – string Reads FLIR .jpg temperature image.

Returns

pd.Dataframe Contains Exiftool metadata tags, raw values and tokenize value and unit.

thermalcognition.reader.read_flir_thermal_image(image_path, mode='FlirFileSDK')¶

Reads FLIR .jpg temperature image.

Parameters

  • image_path – string Path of the .jpg image

  • mode – “FlirFileSDK” or “Exiftool” Exiftool is experimental and gives bad results

Returns

(h, w) ndarray Temperature image

thermalcognition.reader.read_flir_video(video_path)¶

Reads FLIR .seq or .csq temperature video.

Parameters

video_path – string Path of the video

Returns

(n, h, w) ndarray The raw temperature video

thermalcognition.reader.read_flir_visible_image(image_path)¶

Reads FLIR .jpg embedded visible image, using Exiftool. Works with PiP or MSX mode.

Parameters

image_path – string Path of the .jpg image

Returns

(h, w, 3) ndarray Visible image, with 8 bits integers

thermalcognition.reader.read_testo_video(video_path, text_size=(11, 35), up_text_pos=(1, 325), low_text_pos=(-16, 325), thermal_image_shape=(240, 320), dtype=<class 'numpy.float16'>, batch_size=1000)¶

Reads Testo .wmv thermal video.

Parameters

  • video_path – string The video path

  • text_size – (h, w) tuple Shape of the box where to look for digits

  • up_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the upper temperature limit of the colorbar

  • low_text_pos – (y, x) tuple Location of the box related to the lower temperature limit of the colorbar

  • thermal_image_shape – (h,w) tuple Shape of the temperature image, excluding the colorbar, starting from upper left corner

  • dtype – numpy type np.float16, np.float32, np.double, np.long depending of the coding of the temperature values

  • batch_size – int maximum number of frames used by iteration to avoid memory issues

Returns

(n, h, w) ndarray Thermal frames of a video

thermalcognition.reader.read_testo_video_with_firstframe(video_path, xlsx_path, thermal_image_shape=(240, 320), batch_size=1000)¶

Fits the temperature and colors with the first frame Excel

Parameters

  • video_path – string The video path

  • xlsx_path – string The temperature Excel path of the first frame

  • thermal_image_shape – (h,w) tuple Shape of the temperature image

  • batch_size – int maximum number of frames used by iteration to avoid memory issues

Returns

(n, h, w) ndarray Thermal frames of a video

thermalcognition.reader.tokenize_unit_value(raw_value)¶

Splits a raw value string into the related value and unit.

Parameters

raw_value – string

Returns

tuple Contains (value, unit)

synchronization¶

This module contains functions for extracting a lamp temperature, that is switched on at stimulus start and off at stimulus stop.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

23/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.synchronization.get_lamp_temperature(videodata, crops=(0, 120, 0, 80))¶

Finds lamp temperature, as the maximum of temperature in a specific region

Parameters

videodata – (n, h, w) ndarray Thermal video of the face

Returns

(n,) ndarray Maximum temperature of the lamp

vitals¶

This module contains functions for extracting respiratory and heart rate from thermal videos.

copyright

  1. 2020 EPHE

license

MIT License, see LICENSE for details

author

Guillaume Cathelain

organization

EPHE

contact

guillaume.cathelain@gmail.com

date

22/12/2020

version

0.0

thermalcognition.vitals.extrema_trajectory(video, mode='max')¶

Check if extrema temperature of the video have a stable position in time.

Parameters

  • video – (n, h, w) array Contains the temperatures of the region of interest

  • mode – “min”, or “max” Determines the selected statistics of each ROI frame

Returns

(n, 3) array Contains row indices, column indices, and temperature values of extrema in time

thermalcognition.vitals.filter_physio(temp_matrix, fps=100)¶

Filters physiological activities in the temperature matrix

Parameters

  • temp_matrix – (n, line_resolution)

  • fps – float Sampling rate

Returns

(n,) ndarray Maximum of the temperature segments, filtered in the 0.1 to 5 Hz frequency band.

thermalcognition.vitals.get_1dstatistics(video, mode='max')¶

Get 1d statistics of a ROI video, frame by frame

Parameters

  • video – (n, h, w) ndarray Contains the temperatures of the region of interest

  • mode – “mean”, “median”, “min”, or “max” Determines the selected statistics of each ROI frame

Returns

1d array Statistics of the ROI video

thermalcognition.vitals.get_line_temp(index, videodata, landmarks_df, landmark_i=36, landmark_j=31, line_resolution=100)¶

Get the temperature of a line between two landmarks.

Parameters

  • index – int Index of the frame

  • videodata – (n, h, w) array Contains the temperatures of the region of interest

  • landmarks_df – pd.DataFrame Contains landmarks position at every frame

  • landmark_i – int Index of a landmark, default to right side of nose

  • landmark_j – int Index of a landmark, default to left side of right eye

  • line_resolution – int Number of interpolated points of the line from landmark_i to landmark_j

Returns

(n, line_resolution) ndarray Temperature line.

thermalcognition.vitals.get_matrix_temp(videodata, landmarks_df, landmark_i=36, landmark_j=31, line_resolution=100)¶

Concatenation of several temperature lines

Parameters

  • videodata – (n, h, w) array Contains the temperatures of the region of interest

  • landmarks_df – pd.DataFrame Contains landmarks position at every frame

  • landmark_i – int Index of a landmark, default to right side of nose

  • landmark_j – int Index of a landmark, default to left side of right eye

  • line_resolution – int Number of interpolated points of the line from landmark_i to landmark_j

Returns

(n, line_resolution) ndarray Matrix of temperature lines along time.

thermalcognition.vitals.roi_fourier_1dspectrum(video, mode='mean')¶

Get 1d Fourier spectrum of a ROI video, to find fundamentals of heart rate and respiratory rate.

Parameters

  • video – (n, h, w) ndarray Containing the temperatures of the region of interest

  • mode – “mean”, “median”, “min”, or “max” Determines the selected statistics of each ROI frame

Returns

1d array Magnitude of the unilateral spectrum of the ROI 1d statistics
